body:
Yes you are correct.  rclone doesn't fragment files for swift so is limited to the 5 GB file size.

Some thought would need to be given to where to store the chunks and how to avoid seeing them in listings etc (in another container would probably be best).  There are some problems with the MD5SUMs of segmented files too, but it is all possible.

I am guessing the limitation is actually in this implementation (https://github.com/ncw/swift) and it is showing up in this library because it uses that project.  Right?

As you mentioned, supporting chunking for Swift is not totally trivial.

@swill The limitation is in the swift object store.  It has a really clunky way of having files bigger than 5 GB - you have to upload the chunks as separate files then upload an index of them.

The problem is where to store the separate chunks - in a separate container would be ideal so the chunks don't appear in a normal directory listing.

Perhaps the thing to do would be to use the convention used by the swift tool and upload into a separate container called `..._segments`.  See [the openstack large objects doc](http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_large_objects.html) for more info.

The [swift library you linked above](https://github.com/ncw/swift) supports all that just fine but rclone would have to do the heavy listing of making the `_segments` container, uploading the chunks etc.

I wasn't aware of the swift tool convention before - that makes the prospect of doing this a lot more appetizing!
Just adding a +1 to this.  Amazon S3 suffers from the same thing, you have to chunk up >5GB objects, but the client library handles the nuance for you.  This is definitely a plus to have.
@ctennis I'm now using the official Amazon S3 library and also using the chunking support so it should be good for files up to the s3 maximum file size of 5TB.
@ncw yup, got it, so the final blocker to this is just getting a similar type of interface into your swift go bindings, then rclone would be able to use that for larger objects like it does for S3?
@ctennis no patch to the swift module needed, just some code in rclone. It is a non trivial amount of code though :-(

issue.title: Large files support for swift was added

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This must close #46 
It's a quick fix and this is my first experience with Go, so I ask for code review.

For make it works with large files you must add to your rclone.conf `segment-size = 5368709120` and start rclone operations with param ``--size-only=true`, because md5 hash of manifest file isn't equals md5 of original file.

Also in sync copy mode rclone removes segments files, I don't know how to fix this logic in app architecture level. May be we need to add some config flag and handle it in operations.go:409 or operations.go:460.

body: This feature will be released with rclone 1.22

issue.title: Input/output error

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi!

Thanks for this awesome software.  I'm using it with my university's Google Drive unlimited account, encrypted of course.  I'm getting an error after a while trying to use it as a mounted drive.  After some period of time, any file I try to read fails and complains with `Input/output error`.   Re-mounting doesn't fix it.  The only way I've found to fix it, is wait a day or two.

Attached is my -v log file.  I tried `cat duplicity.info` and got `cat: duplicity.info: Input/output error`  Its just a simple text file.

[rclone-debut.txt](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/622052/rclone-debut.txt)


> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
**rclone v1.34**

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
**Linux pontius-vps1 3.13.0-24-generic #46-Ubuntu SMP Thu Apr 10 19:11:08 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux**

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
**University unlimited Google Drive**

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
**rclone mount --max-read-ahead 200M --checkers 300 --read-only -v --allow-other g-drive-work-encrypted: plex-storage-encrypted/**
> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

issue.title: rclone config for crypt does not allow editing of show_mapping value

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

`rclone config` crypt menu option to edit "show_mapping" does not work


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.48.0-DEV
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.12.1
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Linux yidhra 4.15.0-1044-aws #46-Ubuntu SMP Thu Jul 4 13:38:28 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

crypt

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone config -> 

```
Value "show_mapping" = "true"
Edit? (y/n)>
y) Yes
n) No
y/n> y
--------------------
[crypt]
type = <redacted>
remote = <redacted>
filename_encryption = standard
directory_name_encryption = true
password = *** ENCRYPTED ***
password2 = *** ENCRYPTED ***
show_mapping = true
--------------------
```

After saying "Yes I want to edit", rclone returns to the main prompt rather than allowing one to edit the `show_mapping` value.

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

N/A

issue.title: [ErrorMaxTransferLimitReachedFatal] Stop all transferts with cut-off mode soft and cautious

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Issue with cutoff=soft, all in progress transferts stop after first one finished.
Issue with cutoff=cautious, all in progress transfer stop if next transfert reach max-transfert instead of skipping it.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

> rclone v1.53.0
> - os/arch: linux/amd64
> - go version: go1.15

>

> Google Drive

For cautious, I can think of 2 behaviours :
1. Stop spawning new transfert
2. spawn new transfer if file smaller than the remaining size

Regards

See forum: https://forum.rclone.org/t/cutoff-mode-soft-not-working-as-expected-i-think/18913
